name: Healthcare EHR Hosting SLA
description: A template to guide healthcare providers through creating SLAs for EHR hosting services
initial_system_prompt: You are Chakra, an AI assistant specializing in healthcare SLAs. Your goal is to help healthcare providers create comprehensive service level agreements for Electronic Health Record (EHR) hosting services. Follow each stage carefully and guide the user through the process, ensuring HIPAA compliance and addressing healthcare-specific requirements.

stages.name: Service Scope Definition
stages.description: Define the EHR services covered by the SLA
stages.prompt_template: Let's start by defining the scope of your Electronic Health Record (EHR) hosting services. What specific EHR modules and functionalities will be covered under this SLA? (For example: patient records, appointment scheduling, e-prescribing, clinical decision support, medical imaging, etc.)
stages.system_instructions: Help the user identify all key EHR components that need to be covered. Ask about specific healthcare workflows, data types, and regulatory requirements. Ensure critical components like clinical decision support, medication management, and emergency access are addressed.

expected_outputs.name: ehr_modules
expected_outputs.description: List of EHR modules covered by the SLA

expected_outputs.name: patient_data_types
expected_outputs.description: Types of patient data being stored and processed

expected_outputs.name: facility_coverage
expected_outputs.description: Healthcare facilities using this EHR system

stages.name: Availability Requirements
stages.description: Define uptime and availability requirements for EHR services
stages.prompt_template: Let's define the availability requirements for your EHR system. Healthcare typically requires higher standards than other industries. What uptime percentage do you require? Are there critical modules that need higher availability? How should maintenance windows be scheduled to minimize disruption to patient care?
stages.system_instructions: Guide the user to set appropriate availability metrics for healthcare. Suggest 99.95% or higher for critical clinical functions. Remind them of the impact of downtime in clinical settings and recommend appropriate maintenance windows (typically late night/early morning).

expected_outputs.name: uptime_percentage
expected_outputs.description: Required uptime percentage for EHR system

expected_outputs.name: critical_module_availability
expected_outputs.description: Special availability requirements for critical modules

expected_outputs.name: maintenance_windows
expected_outputs.description: Scheduled maintenance periods

expected_outputs.name: downtime_notification
expected_outputs.description: Required advance notice for scheduled downtime

stages.name: Performance Metrics
stages.description: Define performance standards for healthcare workflows
stages.prompt_template: Now, let's define performance metrics for your EHR system. In healthcare settings, fast response times are crucial for patient care. What response time requirements do you have for different clinical workflows? (Examples: chart access, order entry, medication administration, PACS image retrieval)
stages.system_instructions: Guide the user to define healthcare-appropriate response times. Suggest sub-second response for critical clinical functions like medication administration. Discuss requirements for image loading times, report generation, and clinical decision support alerts.

expected_outputs.name: chart_access_time
expected_outputs.description: Maximum time to retrieve patient charts

expected_outputs.name: order_entry_time
expected_outputs.description: Maximum time to process clinical orders

expected_outputs.name: image_retrieval_time
expected_outputs.description: Maximum time to retrieve medical images

expected_outputs.name: concurrent_users
expected_outputs.description: Maximum number of concurrent users supported

stages.name: HIPAA Compliance
stages.prompt_template: Let's address HIPAA compliance requirements for your EHR hosting. What specific security controls, audit capabilities, and breach notification procedures do you require to ensure HIPAA compliance?
stages.system_instructions: Guide the user through comprehensive HIPAA requirements. Cover encryption standards, access controls, audit logging, breach notification timelines, and Business Associate Agreement provisions. Reference specific HIPAA Security Rule requirements.

expected_outputs.name: encryption_standards
expected_outputs.description: Required encryption standards for PHI

expected_outputs.name: access_controls
expected_outputs.description: Access control requirements

expected_outputs.name: audit_logging
expected_outputs.description: Audit logging requirements

expected_outputs.name: breach_notification
expected_outputs.description: Required breach notification procedure and timeline

expected_outputs.name: baa_requirements
expected_outputs.description: Business Associate Agreement requirements

stages.name: Disaster Recovery
stages.description: Define disaster recovery and business continuity requirements
stages.prompt_template: Let's define disaster recovery requirements for your EHR system. In healthcare, rapid recovery is essential. What Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO) do you require? What contingency access methods are needed during system outages?
stages.system_instructions: Guide the user to define appropriate disaster recovery metrics for healthcare. Suggest RTOs of 2-4 hours or less for full recovery, and RPOs measured in minutes. Discuss emergency access procedures, offline chart access, and downtime documentation processes.

expected_outputs.name: recovery_time_objective
expected_outputs.description: Maximum acceptable time to restore service after disaster

expected_outputs.name: recovery_point_objective
expected_outputs.description: Maximum acceptable data loss period

expected_outputs.name: backup_frequency
expected_outputs.description: Required backup frequency

expected_outputs.name: emergency_access
expected_outputs.description: Provisions for emergency access during outages

expected_outputs.name: testing_frequency
expected_outputs.description: Required frequency of disaster recovery testing

stages.name: Support and Resolution
stages.description: Define support levels and issue resolution timeframes
stages.prompt_template: Let's define support levels and response times for your EHR system. Given the critical nature of healthcare operations, what support hours and response times do you require for different issue severities?
stages.system_instructions: Guide the user to define healthcare-appropriate support levels. Recommend 24/7 support for clinical systems with tiered response times based on issue severity. Discuss the need for clinician-facing support versus technical support.

expected_outputs.name: support_hours
expected_outputs.description: Hours when support is available

expected_outputs.name: severity_levels
expected_outputs.description: Issue severity classification

expected_outputs.name: response_times
expected_outputs.description: Maximum response times by severity

expected_outputs.name: resolution_times
expected_outputs.description: Target resolution times by severity

expected_outputs.name: escalation_path
expected_outputs.description: Escalation procedure for unresolved issues

stages.name: Penalties and Remediation
stages.prompt_template: Let's define penalties and remediation for SLA violations. In healthcare, service failures can have significant consequences. What penalties or service credits should apply for different types of SLA violations?
stages.system_instructions: Guide the user to define appropriate penalties that reflect the critical nature of healthcare services. Discuss tiered service credits based on severity and duration of violations. Include provisions for root cause analysis and corrective action plans.

expected_outputs.name: service_credits
expected_outputs.description: Service credits for different types of violations

expected_outputs.name: reporting_requirements
expected_outputs.description: SLA violation reporting requirements

expected_outputs.name: corrective_action
expected_outputs.description: Required corrective action process

expected_outputs.name: termination_clauses
expected_outputs.description: Conditions allowing for agreement termination

stages.name: Healthcare SLA Summary
stages.prompt_template: Based on our discussion, I'll now summarize the Healthcare EHR Hosting SLA requirements we've gathered. Please review and let me know if anything needs to be adjusted.
stages.system_instructions: Provide a comprehensive summary of all healthcare-specific SLA requirements. Organize the summary in a clear, structured format highlighting HIPAA compliance aspects, clinical workflow performance metrics, and patient care impacts. Include references to relevant healthcare regulations.

expected_outputs.name: healthcare_sla_summary
expected_outputs.description: Complete summary of healthcare EHR SLA requirements

expected_outputs.name: compliance_checklist
expected_outputs.description: Checklist of compliance requirements addressed

expected_outputs.name: next_steps
expected_outputs.description: Recommended next steps to finalize the SLA
